intro: Maesa irosinensis, commonly known as the Irosin maesa, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its evergreen shrub form, with small, leathery leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in montane forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
